MERN stack Development

355 Ratings3065 Learners

A complete hands-on course is designed to give you an essence of front-end, middleware, and back-end Javascript web developer technologies. You will learn to build an end-to-end application, test and deploy code using React as front-end framework and Express framework for api using NODE JS as Server environment including Nginx as reverse proxy , store data using MongoDB, and much more.

course-benefits

  • By the end of this course you will be able to use Front end skills like HTML 5,CSS 3,SCSS & Javascript to Design and Develop Dynamic web applications.
  • Also you will build the front end with React Js Including bootstrap 4+ framework.
  • By the end of this course you will be able to use back end skills like Node Js, Express JS, PUG, Mongoose, MongoDB to Design and Develop Dynamic web applications.
  • By the end of this course You will be able to design and Develop REST APIs using Node JS.
  • You will be a full stack MERN Developer By the end of this course.

MERN Full Stack Development CourseSyllabus

MERN Full Stack Development Course

  • HTML 5
  • CSS 3
  • JavaScript ES5, ES6.
  • MongoDB
  • NODE JS(EXPRESS JS + MONGODB)
  • React js

HTML 5

  1. HTML intro
  2. How Browser Works
  3. HTTP and HTML Tree
  4. Nodes Structure
  5. Basic Display Tags
  6. Nesting In HTML
  7. Inheritance Of tags
  8. List In Html
  9. Table in Html
  10. Advance Table Logic
  11. Semantic Elements
  12. HTML 5 More tags
  13. Special Characters in HTML 5

CSS-3

  1. CSS 3 Intro
  2. How CSS Works
  3. CSS History
  4. Types Of CSS
  5. Specificity Magnitude
  6. Advance Selector Types
  7. Box Model
  8. Text Properties
  9. Common CSS Properties
  10. Display In CSS Property
  11. Flex Box
  12. Backgrounds
  13. CSS Positions
  14. CSS Animation 2D
  15. CSS Animation 3D
  16. Pseudo Classes
  17. Pseudo Elements
  18. Rules in CSS
  19. Responsive In CSS
  20. SCSS

Javascript

  1. Basics Part-1
  2. Basics Part-2
  3. JS Native Object and Classes
  4. Event Loop
  5. Arrays and logic.
  6. Strings and Logic
  7. Date and Logic
  8. Custom Objects.
  9. Callback Function
  10. Event Management.
  11. Functional Programming.
  12. Prototyping
  13. Static Method
  14. SET and GET
  15. Inheritance
  16. Method Overriding
  17. Poly Forms
  18. Object/Prop/Methods
  19. Process.
  20. Code Normalization.
  21. Asynchronous.
  22. File Handling.
  23. Local Storage
  24. Cookies
  25. Promises in JS
  26. Async and Await, Fetch
  27. Parallax Effects

NODE JS(EXPRESS JS + MONGODB)

  1. NODE Into
  2. Modules
  3. System Module
  4. 3rd Party Module NPM
  5. Custom Module
  6. Files System In Node
  7. Express JS (Intro)
  8. Basic Application With MVC
  9. Form Handling
  10. Session in Node
  11. Introduction To MongoDB
  12. Mongoose Helper
  13. Basic Query
  14. CRUD in Node
  15. Node + AJAX
  16. File Handling
  17. JWT
  18. Cookies
  19. Crypto In Node JS
  20. Emailing
  21. SMS Gateway
  22. Payment Gateway
  23. Node With PM2
  24. Reverse Proxy
  25. NodeJs + NGINX
  26. Load Balancing
  27. Deployment Of Project On Hosting with Cpanel
  28. Deployment Of Project On Hosting without Cpanel

React JS(ReactJS + MONGODB)

  1. React Into
  2. React Components
  3. JSX
  4. Props and state in react js
  5. React Routing
  6. Axios With React
  7. React Form Handling
  8. Redux
  9. Redux With React
  10. Combining Reducers
  11. Redux Thunk
  12. Animation in React
  13. Auth In React
  14. API Handling And Client Communication CORS
  15. Building and Deploying React Applications.
